verses.verse: After the Sabbath was over as it began to get light into the first of the week, Mary Magdalene and the other Mary came to see the tomb.
But look! There was a great earthquake, for the angel of the Lord came down from heaven, came over, rolled back the stone from the door, and sat on it.
His countenance was like lightning and his clothing white as snow.
Because of fear of him, the guards trembled violently and became as if they were dead.
The angel began to speak and said to the women, "Don't be afraid, for I know that you look for Jesus, who was crucified.
"He is not here, for he is risen as he said. Come; see the place where the Lord lay.
"Go quickly, tell his disciples that he is risen from the dead, and look, he goes ahead of you into Galilee. There you will see him. Look, I have told you."
They left quickly from the tomb with fear and great joy, and they ran to bring his disciples the news.
As they went to tell his disciples, look, Jesus met them, saying, "Rejoice." They came, held on to his feet, and worshiped him.
Then Jesus said to them, "Don't be afraid. Go, tell my brothers to go to Galilee, and they will see me there."
Now as they were on their way--look!-- some of the guard came into the city and reported all the things that happened to the chief priests.

When they were gathered together with the elders and had taken counsel, they gave a lot of money to the soldiers, Mat 28:13 saying, "Say this: Â«His disciples came by night and stole him while we slept.'
"If this is heard by the governor, we will pacify him and make it safe for you."
So they took the money and did as they were taught. This saying is commonly reported among the Jews to this day.
Then the eleven disciples went into Galilee to a mountain where Jesus had appointed to them.
When they saw him, they worshiped him, but some doubted.
Jesus came and spoke to them, saying, "All power is given to me in heaven and in earth.
"Therefore go, teach all nations, baptizing them in the name of the Father and the Son and the Holy Spirit.
"Teaching them to carefully attend to everything whatever I have commanded you, and lo, I am with you always even to the end of the world." Amen.
